undertakings: Self Certification for Minimum Local Content
buyer_terms: Uphold all commercial terms unless deviations listed
eligibility_criteria: Any bidder from a country sharing a land border with India must be registered with Competent Authority
document_submission_req: Upload deviation statement with technical bid, submit self-certifications for local content
important_terms: Deviation Statement to be filled by Tenderer
Margin of Purchase Preference up to 20%
License fees/royalties paid out of India excluded from local content
Contracts above INR 10 Crore require certified local content
Penalties for false local content declaration
Reciprocity clause in Public Procurement Order 2017
full_text_summary: The document outlines terms for participating in a tender by HAL, emphasizing the importance of compliance with commercial and local content requirements. Key details include the necessity for a deviation statement, adherence to a two-packet bidding system, and conformance to purchase preference policies. Bidders from countries sharing a land border with India need to be registered with the Competent Authority, and local content certifications are mandatory. Significant penalizations apply for false declarations, and there are specific provisions for MSMEs under the divisible goods category.
